doc.field: Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush
Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush

The Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush consist of two black-and-white mounted photographic prints showing classes at P. S. 139, located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1915.

The Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush consist of two black-and-white mounted photographic prints showing classes at P. S. 139, located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1915.

The Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush consist of two black-and-white mounted photographic prints showing classes at P. S. 139, located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1915. Both photographs include notes on the verso identifying the school and its location. One photograph includes a handwritten note on the verso naming "Mordorf" as principal and also names "Marta Boderstrom Riedemann," presumably a student in the photograph.
P.S. 139 is located at 330 Rugby Road (near Cortelyou) in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn. In 1915, Oliver C. Mordorf served as principal of the school.

Source and date of acquisition for this collection cannot be verified. There is some evidence that it was either donated or purchased from Brooklyn Union Gas. The collection was formally accessioned in 1992.
